items.title: Health Canada ignored expert advice to expand access to safe drugs for opioid users, internal documents show
items.description: As deadly drug overdoses climbed across Canada, decision-makers faced political backlash for funding programs that gave drug users prescribed opioids and, against their own experts’ advice, scaled back their support of safe supply programs, an investigation by CBC’s the fifth estate has found.

items.description: The decision, handed down late Wednesday, is said to be a major disappointment for those caring for the vulnerable population.

items.title: Saskatchewan farming group raises concerns over foreign land ownership

items.title: Quebec men accused in alleged extremist plot will go to trial following federal indictment
items.description: Three Quebec men accused of facilitating terrorism will be sent to trial after the federal Crown prosecutor’s office filed a direct indictment on Nov. 7, along with new charges.

items.title: Calgary city councillors, mayor to introduce motion to repeal citywide rezoning
items.description: The motion calls on city administration to revert the Calgary's land-use bylaw to what it was prior to the previous city council approving citywide rezoning back in 2024.

items.title: N.S. missing kids: Volunteers to focus search on riverbanks for Lilly and Jack
items.description: The renewed search in Pictou County is being led by the Ontario-based not-for-profit group, Bring Me Home. Lilly and Jack have been missing for over six months.
